meanings.definition: A type of joint in which the bones are rigidly fused together.
meanings.sent1: The synarthrosis between the two bones ensured no movement at all.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the synarthrosis to understand how bones can be fused together.
meanings.sent3: The synarthrosis was so strong that even a giant couldn't break it!
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a synarthrosis, unbreakable and solid.
meanings.sent5: The synarthrosis in the ancient statue depicted eternal unity.

meanings.definition: The immovable articulation of bones, as in the skull.
meanings.sent1: The synarthrosis in the skull provides stability and protection.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the synarthrosis in the skull differs from other joints.
meanings.sent3: The synarthrosis in the skull made the skeleton look like a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a synarthrosis, keeping her focused and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The synarthrosis in the skull was like a fortress, guarding the brain within.
